metadata.title: CVE-2023-5380 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A use-after-free flaw was found in the xorg-x11-server. An X server crashmay occur in a very specific and legacy configuration (a multi-screen setupwith multiple protocol screens, also known as Zaphod mode) if the pointeris warped from within a window on one screen to the root window of theother screen and if the original window is destroyed followed by anotherwindow being destroyed.

criterions.comment: xorg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xorg-server: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xorg-server-hwe-16.04: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
